post.description:
Make a request to the Forms-2 model and receive JSON response data.

#### File upload options
We support requests with Content-Type `application/json` or `multipart/form-data`. Note that `application/json` requests are preferred as `multipart/form-data` requests do not support all flags and fields.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data
- `[multipart/form-data]` **file**  upload local file from browser. TODO: add file types

Make a request to the Forms model and receive response data in a ZIP file.

#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

#### Response zip file contents
| File  | Description |
| ----- | ------- |
| .csv  | CSV containing a breakdown of the itemization |
| .json | JSON file containing the entire JSON response |
| .txt  | TXT file containing the entire JSON response |
| file  | The original uploaded file |

The default name for the file is an epoch timestamp if `fileId` field is not included in the request.TODO

Queue an asynchronous request to Forms model and receive response data in a ZIP file, sent to an `outputURL`.

#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

#### Response zip file contents
| File  | Description |
| ----- | ------- |
| .csv  | CSV containing a breakdown of the itemization |
| .json | JSON file containing the entire JSON response |
| .txt  | TXT file containing the entire JSON response |
| file  | The original uploaded file |

The default name for the file is an epoch timestamp if `fileId` field is not included in the request.

get.summary: Get status of an async request
get.description: Get the status of an async zip request.

post.description:
Make a request to a custom Forms model and receive JSON response data.

#### File upload options
We support requests with Content-Type `application/json` or `multipart/form-data`. Note that `application/json` requests are preferred as `multipart/form-data` requests do not support all flags and fields.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data
- `[multipart/form-data]` **file**  upload local file from browser

Make a request to Forms model and receive response data in a ZIP file.

#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

#### Response zip file contents
| File  | Description |
| ----- | ------- |
| .csv  | CSV containing a breakdown of the itemization |
| .json | JSON file containing the entire JSON response |
| .txt  | TXT file containing the entire JSON response |
| file  | The original uploaded file |

The default name for the file is an epoch timestamp if `fileId` field is not included in the request.

model.title: model
model.description: Model used to process the document.

content.description: Content of the field as a string.

boundingRegions.description: Location of key value pair in the document.

inputUrl.title: inputURL
inputUrl.description: URL for the file to extract data from: Must be a PDF, JPEG, PNG, or TIFF.

base64.title: base64
base64.description: Base64 encoded string for the file to extract data from. If it is an array, the base64 strings will be appended into one PDF then ran through the model.

file.title: file
file.description: File to upload: Must be a PDF, JPEG, PNG, or TIFF.

outputUrl.title: outputURL
outputUrl.description: URL where resulting zip file should be sent. Must be open to PUT requests. Required if submitting an async request.

fileId.title: fileId
fileId.description: Custom ID for document. If not present, will default to file name.

metadata.title: metadata
metadata.description: Custom JSON to be included in the returned response.

outputUrlHeaders.title: outputURLHeaders
outputUrlHeaders.description: Request headers to include in the PUT request to the output URL.

webhook.title: webhook
webhook.description: Webhook to ping after API runs.

webhookSendFull.title: webhookSendFull
webhookSendFull.description: Set to true to send all response data to webhook upon request completion, otherwise only send request status.

forceBase64.title: forceBase64
forceBase64.description: Setting this parameter to true converts files to Base64 format before sending them on to the model.

forceOCR.title: forceOCR
forceOCR.description: Set this parameter to true if the input file is a fillable pdf.

statusId.title: statusId
statusId.description: WARNING: Deprecating in favor of 'fileId'. Custom ID for document. If not present, will default to file name.

value.message: Request body is missing required field(s): question

400.description: Bad request or failure to read. Request was invalid or we could not process your data.

value.message: Request body is missing required field(s): question

403.description: Unauthorized attempt. There was an issue with your credentials, model permissions or billing.

404.description: Not found error. When a request references an invalid endpoint or resource.

500.description: Model processing failed. Extraction model or LLM could not process your request.

value.message: Error during request to OCR microservice.
We made three attempts to process the model with no success.
